Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2009 11:49PM roachrp wrote: carla, i sent you a PM.  also, to those of you who are wondering about changing her2neu status, i, too, was bothered by this thought and insisted that the onc do a serum her2 blood test, which is a send out, like cell search.  mine came back one point above the normal range, so they ruled it negative, but at least i had some peace of mind that i tried that route.  just wanted you to know that the serum test is an option some may want to pursue.  best wishes to all of you ladies.  this disease stinks! jeanne
Posts.Title: Crap Liver Mets ccarter48818 sportsmom

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2009 08:15AM roachrp wrote: thanks so much, chelev!  a couple questions?  does the foam work better than the lotion?  and which antibiotic did you take orally, if you remember?  did anyone take samples from your scalp to examine or culture?  did you do anything for the itch?  i only wear my wig if i have to go out somewhere.  i try to keep my head uncovered at home.  if i do put a scarf or headcover on, my head gets hot and sweats and i think that might make it worse.  thanks so much for sharing.  it really helps to hear from someone who has gone through it.  wishing you all the best!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2009 01:18PM roachrp wrote: patti...i washed my headcovers like mad to see if it would help.  ultimately, going without felt the best.  the coolness of air on my head and the coolness of the peroxide swabbing felt fabulous.  i bought an "antibacterial wig cap" and a gel ring to wear under my wig when i had to go out.  the antibacterial cap didn't seem to do much for me...plus it was tight.  i still use the gel ring.  it keeps the wig from sitting on the stubble and irritating the scalp.  if i had to wear something to go out, i would remove it immediately when i got home and swab with the peroxide.  bumps have been totally gone for a long while now, all i do is wash my head with dove soap and a washcloth at night.  i'm glad you are seeing some improvement!  hugs to you!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2009 09:28PM roachrp wrote: hi ladies. not sure if this is the right place to ask this question, but i'll give it a shot.   i have developed a rash on my bald head which, from reading some posts, is apparently folliculitis.  i called my onc and got a rx for a clindamycin lotion, to be applied twice/day.  i began applying on wednesday, and today the rash seems worse and itchier.  anyone have experience with this problem, who might give me an idea about how long it takes the clindamycin to clear it up?  when she prescribed it, the PA told me it usually clears up quickly, so i wasn't expecting any worsening.  if i am posting in the wrong spot, please redirect me.  thanks so much for your shared wisdom!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2009 12:16PM - edited Aug 1, 2009 12:17PM by roachrp just wanted to post on folliculitis.  when i lost my hair on taxanes, i developed a nasty acne-like rash on my bald head.  i read a lot of posts on this site, tried the clindamycin cream, which only seemed to irritate my rash, and was going nuts.  i finally decided to stop the cream and just use a cotton ball to apply hydrogen peroxide 3%.  not only did it feel amazing to have something cool on my super irritated head, but it cleared up the folliculitis beautifully and quickly.  so if anyone else is trying unsuccessfully to deal with this problem, you may want to give hydrogen peroxide a try.  i did it a few times a day for a few days, then switched to morning and night.  best of luck to all of you!  hugs!

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2009 02:19PM roachrp wrote: 39, although i had been asking for nine years, since nursing my first child, about a lump in my breast.  when someone finally mammogrammed it, they said they saw nothing.  nine years later, living in another city, that lump began to grow.  it was cancer with micrometastasis to 3 nodes.  i now am metatstatic to bones and liver and had another breast cancer in 2005.  my mom had breast cancer at 40 and is still around at 84 with no adjuvant treatment.  my 21 year old daughter thinks about it constantly.  how soon is too soon to start checking??

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2009 02:36AM roachrp wrote: update..had first gemzar on wednesday.  have been in bed with a fever since thursday.  it is now sunday.  i woke up shivering so hard on thursday night that i pulled or fractured something in my shoulder (bone mets as well).  so in addition to the fever and liver pain, it is very hard to move around.  have gone as high as 101.7, but could have been higher...i didn't take temp in middle of night.  that's my news.  i hope the rest of you gemzar ladies are well!  if anyone has had this experience, please let me know how you coped.  appreciate it!
Posts.Title: tumor fevers? roachrp roachrp

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2009 01:05PM roachrp wrote: i, too, abhor general anesthesia.  i wouldn't hesitate to meet with the anesthesiologist to discuss your concerns and see if you can't come to some sort of compromise.  i have had success meeting in the middle for minor surgeries, where i took some ativan beforehand and then was given just the least amount of drugs to do the procedure, minus the tube down my throat.  made it a lot easier.  also, once for a suspicious lump that was palpable and near the surface, i requested a local and the surgeon allowed it.  i couldn't feel a thing.  best of luck to you!
Posts.Title: terrified of surgery - anesthesia interactions/problems? sueelizabeth676 roachrp
